DATATYPE.Description: A very small integer. The signed range is -128 to 127. The unsigned range is 0 to 255.
A small integer. The signed range is -32768 to 32767. The unsigned range is 0 to 65535.
A medium-size integer. The signed range is -8388608 to 8388607. The unsigned range is 0 to 16777215.
A normal-size integer. The signed range is -2147483648 to 2147483647. The unsigned range is 0 to 4294967295.
A normal-size integer. The signed range is -2147483648 to 2147483647. The unsigned range is 0 to 4294967295.
A large integer. The signed range is -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807. The unsigned range is 0 to 18446744073709551615.
A small (single-precision) floating-point number. Cannot be unsigned. Allowable values are -3.402823466E+38 to -1.175494351E-38, 0, and 1.175494351E-38 to 3.402823466E+38.
A small (single-precision) floating-point number. Cannot be unsigned. Allowable values are -3.402823466E+38 to -1.175494351E-38, 0, and 1.175494351E-38 to 3.402823466E+38.

A normal-size (double-precision) floating-point number. Cannot be unsigned. Allowable values are -1.7976931348623157E+308 to -2.2250738585072014E-308, 0, and 2.2250738585072014E-308 to 1.7976931348623157E+308.
This is a synonym for DOUBLE.
This is a synonym for DOUBLE.
An unpacked floating-point number. Cannot be unsigned. Behaves like a CHAR column.
This is a synonym for DECIMAL.
A date. The supported range is \a1000-01-01\a to \a9999-12-31\a.
A date and time combination. The supported range is \a1000-01-01 00:00:00\a to \a9999-12-31 23:59:59\a.
A timestamp. The range is \a1970-01-01 00:00:00\a to sometime in the year 2037. The length can be 14 (or missing), 12, 10, 8, 6, 4, or 2 representing YYYYMMDDHHMMSS, ... , YYYYMMDD, ... , YY formats.
A time. The range is \a-838:59:59\a to \a838:59:59\a.
A year in 2- or 4-digit format (default is 4-digit).

A fixed-length string (1 to 255 characters) that is always right-padded with spaces to the specified length when stored. values are sorted and compared in case-insensitive fashion according to the default character set unless the BINARY keyword is given.
A variable-length string (1 to 255 characters). Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion unless the BINARY keyword is given.
This is a synonym for CHAR(1).
This is a synonym for CHAR(1).
A column maximum length of 255 (2^8 - 1) characters. Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion.
A column maximum length of 65535 (2^16 - 1) characters. Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion.
A column maximum length of 16777215 (2^24 - 1) characters. Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion.
A column maximum length of 4294967295 (2^32 - 1) characters. Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion.
A column maximum length of 255 (2^8 - 1) characters.
A column maximum length of 65535 (2^16 - 1) characters.
A column maximum length of 16777215 (2^24 - 1) characters.
A column maximum length of 4294967295 (2^32 - 1) characters.
An enumeration. A string object that can have only one value, chosen from the list of values.
A set. A string object that can have zero or more values, each of which must be chosen from the list of values.
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype

TABLE.Comments: This table contains the values of Meta Felds related to a specific entitty table (task, request, project, risk, etc)

This table contain the values of Meta Field but when the meta field is defined to a grid object. Because of this, this table must contain the fields line and col in order to store information in a \Agrid\A format;
This table contains all company areas used by system to categorize an user department area.
This table is a index of all artifacts that was created into the system related to a specifica entity (task, request, risk, etc) and the artifact content table.

This table contains the artifacts templates to be optionally used by project members. A template is a piece of content pre-formated that can be used to create for example, a specification, a project document, etc

Contain a lista of all attachment files related to the system entities (tasks, request, projects, etc). Each entity ID will be defined by planning_id and the payload of file (binary data will be stored at binary_file column)
This table contain the life-cycle history of each attachment file.
This table contains a list of all system categories. A category could be used to give more qualification for requests, tasks, risks, etc of a specific project.

COLUMN.Comments: if it is 1 the category is applicable to the requirement, if it is 0=task; 2=Report; 3=KPI; 4=Risk; 5=Workflow; 6=Discussion; 7=Invoice; 9=Cost and 10=Occurrence
define if category is related with a billable task of non-billable task. Applyable only for tasks.
if 1, the category will be hidden at GUI
define if the category is related to a defect task. Applyable only for tasks.
define if the category is related to a Testing Task. Applyable only for tasks.
define if the category is related to a development task. Applyable only for tasks.
define the order of category apperance at at GUI

TABLE.Comments: This table contains the cost specification for all projects. The cost value will be defined at installment_cost table. Even the expenses (created by project member to refound) are costs. In this case, the field expense_id will be defined with the ID of the expense created.
Each time a cost information is changed, it is possible to restore historically the life-cicle of a project cost.

COLUMN.Comments: value in cents

TABLE.Comments: This table contains the values of a cost record. It\as is possible to separate a cost in N installments. Each installment could be approved by a project member that have permission to deny or allow the adding of this cost into the project costs.

COLUMN.Comments: value in cents

TABLE.Comments: List of status of each cost. The state machine order contain a sequence that define the cost life-cycle.
This table contains a list of IDs of each mata form. Each line of this table represents a record that could be shown and edited into a specific meta form created previously (see table meta_form).

This table contains the match between a workflow node and the information that will be used to create a new task (when the workflow node was instantiated). After task creation, the column related_task_id will contain the ID of the task created.

This table contains all customers of all projects. Each customer ID must be included into the user table, in order to follow the hierarcal architecture where a Customer entity IS A User entity.\n\nBesides, the customer entity contains a number of attributes of the relationship between the specific customer and the project (exemple: enable status, pre approving permission, etc). Due to a Resource and Leader entities are automatically a Customer entity, all the attibutes defined into the customer table will be inherited by Resource and Leader entities.

COLUMN.Comments: if it is \a1\a the current customer is disabled to perform actions for the related project
if it is \a1\a the current customer is allowed to view the technical comments that was written by resources into the tasks.

TABLE.Comments: This table contains a list of functions of each project resource (project members). Into the system, the members can assume a specific profile into the project (\aleader\a, \aresource\a or \Acustomer\A) but can assume a number of roles that is defined at \afunction\a table (for example: developer, DBA, project management, quality assurance, etc).\n\nThe profile is related with the permission level into the system. The roles are more abstract and are related with the works that the members can do into the project.

Plandora are able to integrate with SVN repository, but also contain a internal repository. This table contains the repository items when the project repository defined but a project is \ADB Repository\a.
This table is used to control the increment of each repository item version. For each project that was defined with \ARepository DB\A this table contains the last version repository item.

This table contains the payload of the repository file. The \Aversion\A column is part of PK. It means that this table can contain a lot of versions for the same repository item. Plandora is not able to optimize the disk space of the file versions. Each version will be stored wholly.

This table contains the workflow decision nodes representation. The administrator user is able to create workflows, and the nodes will be stored at \adecision_node_template\a and \astep_node_template\a.
This table contains all departments of all companies. It can be used to categorize an user or used into reports.
This table is related a feature under construction (until version 1.13.0)

This table contains the events generated by system. The events are stored into data base and could be used for audit purposes. The Logger Agent saves an event information into this table as well. The event table contains the reference (username) to the user that has included the event but it doesn\at has any FK to tool_user table.
This table contains all expenses generated by project members. Tipically, the members applies expense values to be refauld by the project budget. This expenses must be aproved by project leaders.
This table contains all company functions (for HR purposes). It can be used to categorize an user and into reports.
This table contains all project invoices. It can be used to input all bills generated by project efford.
This table contains the life-cycle of an invoice. Each record contains the information of an invoice in a specific moment.
This table contains the parts of the invoice. Each record contributes with a part of total value (debit or credit).

COLUMN.Comments: 1-Service (credit); 2-Product (credit); 3-Taxes (debit); 4-Discount (debit)
value in cents
\A1\A=credit; \A-1\A=debit

TABLE.Comments: This table contains all possible status of invoices. The field \astate_machine_order\a defines the order of invoice status at \Astate machine\A. The value \A1\A represents a initial state and the values \A100\A and \A101\A represents the final state.
This table contains the IDs of all project leaders. Each leader ID should be into the \Aresource\A table, to suit the architecture hierarchical where a Leader entity IS A Resource entity.

Ths table contains all custom fields created by administrator user for the forms defined by field \aApply_to\a. It\as possible to add fields at Plandora native forms (request form, project form, task form, etc) or even create custom fields to a custom form.

This table contain a lista of all meta forms of the system. A meta form is a specific purpose table created by the system administrator (root) and contains a list of meta fields and a list of users of tool that can edit it (see the form Users). It is possible to setup a Javascript snip that will be executed by tool after / before saving a record or after load the form.
This table contains all workflow nodes. A workflow is a group of nodes (step nodes or decision nodes). A node is the small part of workflow and after created will be turned into a task.
This table contains the notification/alerts agents of system. A notification is an agent that starts in a determined moment and runs a customized procedure by a specific channel

COLUMN.Comments: The class signature (package and class name) that implements the notification channel (email, http, etc)
The SQL that contains the business rule of notiication. In other words, if the SQL return some data from DB means that something should be done by the notificator.
Number of times that the notification engine will try to run the agent.
Date/time provisioned by system to run the agent.
If null, the current agent is active.
The minute that the agent must be run.
The hour that the agent must be run.
The periodicity of agent: 1-Yearly; 2-Monthly; 3-Weekly; 4-Daily; 5-Eventually

TABLE.Comments: This table contains the fields used by the agents to provide the parameters used for agent engines. For example: the email notification agent knows how to send an e-mail but it need some information about that SMPT server, user, etc. Thus, the records of this table will be used to customized the notification GUI.

This table contain the sequence used by system to increment the ids of the most of tables. The architecture of system was desing to avoid using features of specific data bases. A \Asequence\A feature and \Aauto-increment ID\A feature are available in many commercial data bases, but each data base has a specific rule to create and increment the sequence. Then, Plandora controls the \AID sequence\A storing the next ID available in this table.

COLUMN.Comments: Unique Sequential ID

TABLE.Comments: This entity is an abstraction of the main planning entities of system, i.e, Task, Requirement , Risks, Occurrences, Invoices, Costs, Project, etc.\nThis \Asuper-entity\A contain the common fields of all planning entities.
This table contain the system preferences of each user.
This table contain all projects of system.
This table contain the life-cycle of a project. Each state transition of project is stored here.

This table contain all status of project. Each status is related to a numeric constant used into the system to define the status. This constant is following: 1 - Project Opened ; 2 - Project on-Hold ; 3 - Project Aborted/Closed, etc

This table contain all Report or KPI records of system. Each Report or KPI contain a SQL statement. A Report uses the SQL statement to populate data into the Jasper report layout. In the other hand the system timer uses the SQL statement from a KPI record to generate an indicator value from data base and set the new value into the report_result table.

COLUMN.Comments: Project id related with the metric
Metric Type (1=daily, etc)
If it is a KPI, define the BSC perspective, otherwise is NULL
SQL statement that implement the metric business rule.
Execution time of metric (hour that timer should wake up to run the SQL)
Last execution date/time
Final date of metric. If NULL the metric is alive, otherwise, contain the date/time of exclusion.
Type of metric data (1=date, 0=float, etc)
If the current record is a KPI this field is null, otherwise, contain the path of Jasper file used by report engine.

TABLE.Comments: his table contain the values (metrics) generated by timer when it wake up and run a KPI\as SQL clausule.
This table contain all requests of system (bugs, support requests, system requirement, etc).
Each request has the own life cycle, and this table contain the information about the historical occurrence of the all requests.

This table contain a list of all status of the requirement. Each status is related to a numeric constant used into the system to define the status. This constant is following: 1 - Waiting Approve ; 100 - Planned ; 200 - Canceled ; 201 - Closed ; 202 - Refused ; 300 - In-Progress

This table contain all resources of all project. Each resource ID should be into the customer table, to respect the architecture hierarchy where a Resource entity IS A Customer entity.\nBesides, the resource entity contain a number of attributes of the relationship between the specific resource and the project (example: cost, capacity, etc). Due to a Leader entity is automatically a Resource entity, all this attibutes defines into the resource table will be inherited by Leader entity.

COLUMN.Comments: If it is \a1\a the resource could set tasks for him self
If is is \a1\a the resource could view into the \Aresource task\A form the name of the customer that made the request.

TABLE.Comments: This table contain the allocation of resource for a specific task. Contain the general information about the status, task date and duration. However, there are another table (resource_task_alloct) that contain the time values day by day. For example, if a resource_task contain a task that should be completed in 12 hours, then, there are two related records in resource_task_alloc with value = 8 and 4.
This table contain the allocation of human resources for a specific task. An allocation is a quantity of minutes used by resource to work in the task.
This table contain only one record. It is the ID of root user and is always \A3\A and it is alwayed related to the project \A0\A. The project \A0\A it is the root project.
This table contains the workflow task nodes representation. The administrator user is able to create workflows, and the nodes will be stored at \adecision_node_template\a and \astep_node_template\a.
This table contain a list of all tasks of system. A task represent a work event performed by the resources of project.

COLUMN.Comments: Parent Task ID. The parent task is used to join a group of tasks.
If it is 0 the current task is a common task, if it is 1 the task is a joinner task (used to join a group of tasks)

TABLE.Comments: Each task has the own life cycle, and this table contain the information about the historical occurrence of the task.

This table contain all status of task. Each status is related to a numeric constant used into the system to define the status. This constant is following: 1 - Task Open ; 100 - Task Closed ; 101 - Task Canceled ; 20 - Task In ProgressI ; 50 - Task on-Hold
This table contain all users of system, independently of project or role.

COLUMN.Comments: Representative color of user (used by Gantt Chart bars to identify a task assigned to user). It is a RGB hexadecimal pattern (ex: FF0000 = red, C2C2C2= gray, etc)

TABLE.Comments: This table contains all companies that will be used to link with the project members.

This table contain a list of projects where a KPI is applied. The KPI generation engine could consider a list of projects for the same indicator and generating different values (report_result) in the same time.
This table contains the information used by Plandora to import data from external applications, for example: JIRA or email2Requests.
This table contains zero or many attachments from system source that must be imported to Plandora.
